title: Know The Coverage Benefits of Piccolo Insurance (Michel Jordan)
text: By Michel Jordan Sep 20, 2015 When you have a beautiful, slender and delicate musical instrument to call your own, you can be engulfed in numerous emotions. You know the musical instrument is not only precious, but it also deserves your care and attention. Whether you use the instrument for satisfying your personal hobby or in a more professional capacity, you have to take care of it just like you'd care for a little child. The best way to prove your love for the musical instrument is by insuring it. There are several, specifically designed instrument insurance readily available nowadays so that you can choose the one that best suits your needs. Moreover, if you own a rare instrument, such as a piccolo, insurance is a must for you. Let's take a look at some of the coverage benefits you will receive upon purchasing piccolo insurance.Breakage Coverage BenefitsOne of the most common threats for musical instruments is breakage. A simple fall or a thud can cause your piccolo to have a dent or it could stop producing the desirable sound. Repairing a piccolo is quite expensive, considering the fact that it is a rare instrument. But when you have insured it, you can be assured that you can claim the cost of repair should the instrument be damaged.Natural Disaster Coverage BenefitsSometimes you cannot prevent your precious instrument from damage, especially if the cause is a natural disaster. By purchasing appropriate flute insurance, you can be assured that if an earthquake or flood damages your instrument, you can seek compensation from the insurance company.Replacement Coverage BenefitsIf you are performing in a grand event and need more instruments than you own, you will have to hire them. But borrowing or renting instruments can be risky, more so, if you break or damage it in any way. Most insurance companies offer coverage benefits for instruments you borrow or rent. Difference in Value CoverageMusic insurance companies also offer another type of coverage benefit known as the difference in value coverage. Basically, this means that the difference in value of an instrument, before it's damaged and after the loss is taken into account before settling the claim.Repurchasing BenefitsIf you filed for a claim because your precious piccolo was stolen or lost and in the meantime, you located the instrument with someone else, insurance companies have an option where they settle the amount with the customer so that you can have the instrument back.Benefits For Retaining Undamaged Parts Everything cannot be measured only by its market value, especially with musical instruments that you become emotionally attached with. As one of the coverage benefits offered by musical instrument insurance, you can keep undamaged parts in case of loss of an instrument.Musical instrument insurance has become one of the necessities in today's world. With the escalating price of instruments, it is only a wise decision to purchase insurance. However, keep in mind to choose a company that offers you the best policies, the best rates and easy claims. About the Author Author understands the sentimental value musicians attach to their instruments. After working in the insurance industry for over a decade, he knows how to persuade musicians to buy piccolo insurance. Rating:
